alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:53PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong winds and localized blowing dust will impact portions of Yuma County through 630 PM MDT... At 548 PM MDT, strong winds emanating from thunderstorms in Washington county were progressing southeastward into Yuma county, roughly along a line extending from 17 miles northwest of Wray to 5 miles west of Eckley to 15 miles south of Yuma. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and locally reduced visibilities associated with blowing dust. SOURCE...At 539 PM MDT, an automated observation site in Yuma reported sustained winds of 39 mph gusting to 48 mph with a visibility reduced to two and a half miles in association with blowing dust. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions, particularly on Highway 34 and Highway 385 in Yuma county. Strong winds and blowing dust will be near... Eckley around 600 PM MDT. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 223 and 263. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
